thread.title: Ryanair launches petition to curb air traffic control strikes
thread.title_full: Ryanair launches petition to curb air traffic control strikes

title: Ryanair launches petition to curb air traffic control strikes
text:
Ryanair launches petition to curb air traffic control strikes 1 July 2015 Save 
Ryanair has launched a petition in a bid to eliminate what it calls “repeated blackmail and disruption” by air traffic control (ATC) unions. 
The low cost airline wants the European Commission and European Parliament to either ban strikes or allow other ATCs to manage strikes during industrial action. 
Ryanair has said it will present the petition to lawmakers when it attracts 1 million signatures, 
Ryanair’s Kenny Jacobs said: “It’s unacceptable that Europe’s consumers repeatedly have their holiday and travel plans disrupted or cancelled by the selfish actions of ATC unions every summer, who use strikes as a first weapon rather than a last resort. 
“French ATC unions will again stage three further days of strikes this week, which will impact hundreds of thousands of European consumers. 
“It is particularly reprehensible that these strikes are taking place at the height of the peak summer season, deliberately targeting holiday makers and families.”
